keyMoments.title: Bartolomeo's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Bartolomeo the Cannibal makes his anime debut as he enters the Corrida Colosseum for the Block B battle, immediately being heckled by the hostile crowd.
keyMoments.significance: First introduction of a future Straw Hat Grand Fleet captain and one of Luffy's most devoted fans.

keyMoments.title: Throws Fake Bomb at Crowd
keyMoments.description: Bartolomeo throws a fake bomb into the crowd in response to their heckling, causing mass panic and establishing his trolling personality.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Bartolomeo's character as someone who doesn't care about public opinion and enjoys antagonizing others.
keyMoments.quote: You all seem to be having fun! Here's a present for you!

reveals.information: Known as 'Bartolomeo the Cannibal' due to his mockery of rivals
Has a bounty of 150 million berries
Competing in the Corrida Colosseum tournament for the Mera Mera no Mi

keyMoments.title: Blue Gilly Debuts
keyMoments.description: Blue Gilly, a martial artist from the Longleg Tribe, makes his first appearance as one of the Block B competitors, demonstrating his leg-based fighting style.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of a Longleg Tribe member in the tournament and future Straw Hat Grand Fleet member.

abilities.description: A leg-based martial arts style practiced by the Longleg Tribe. Blue Gilly's legs are comparable to a steel whip and move so fast it's hard to predict where his kicks will come from.

reveals.information: Master of Jao Kun Do martial arts

keyMoments.title: Ricky Debuts in Disguise
keyMoments.description: A mysterious gladiator named Ricky appears in Block B, wearing armor and helmet that conceals his identity. He is actually Riku Doldo III, the former king of Dressrosa.
keyMoments.significance: The former king enters the tournament in disguise, setting up a major reveal about Dressrosa's history and the true nature of Doflamingo's rule.

reveals.information: Participating in the Corrida Colosseum tournament

keyMoments.title: Tank Lepanto's Debut
keyMoments.description: Tank Lepanto, the defense captain of Dressrosa, makes his first appearance as a competitor in Block B, revealing he has been coaxed into fighting for the Prodence Kingdom for money.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the corruption and mercenary nature of some of Dressrosa's officials, foreshadowing the kingdom's problems.
keyMoments.quote: Money is what makes the world go round! Dreams are unimportant because I prefer to collect the easiest money I can possibly acquire.

reveals.information: Defense captain of Dressrosa fighting for the Prodence Kingdom for money
Values money over dreams and loyalty

keyMoments.title: Hack's Debut
keyMoments.description: Hack, a Japanese soldierfish fish-man and member of the Revolutionary Army, makes his debut as a Block B competitor known as 'Hundredth Dan' Hack.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of a Revolutionary Army member in the tournament, connecting the storyline to the broader Revolutionary Army plot.

abilities.description: A martial arts style practiced by fish-men. Hack serves as a combat instructor for the Revolutionary Army and taught Koala.

relationships.description: Hack trained Koala in Fish-Man Karate when she joined the Revolutionary Army.

reveals.information: Member of the Revolutionary Army serving as combat instructor

keyMoments.title: Reveals Hatred of Worst Generation
keyMoments.description: Cavendish explains to Luffy (as Lucy) why he despises the Worst Generation supernovas, revealing that they stole his fame and glory when they emerged three years ago.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Cavendish's primary motivation and creates dramatic irony as he confides in the very person he wants to kill.
keyMoments.quote: When I came to the New World about three years ago, I made a big name for myself. But my fame was overshadowed by the Battle of Marineford, the Eleven Supernovas, and the Blackbeard Pirates!

keyMoments.title: Learns Lucy's True Identity
keyMoments.description: Cavendish discovers that Lucy is actually Monkey D. Luffy when Don Chinjao addresses him by his real name.
keyMoments.significance: Creates immediate tension as Cavendish now knows he's been talking to one of the Worst Generation members he wants to kill.

bounties.reason: Super Rookie pirate and captain of the Beautiful Pirates

relationships.description: Cavendish hates Luffy as part of the Worst Generation who stole his fame, though he initially didn't know Lucy was Luffy.

evolutionMoments.description: Discovers Lucy's true identity as Luffy, one of the Worst Generation he despises.

reveals.information: Hates the Worst Generation for stealing his fame and glory
Came to the New World three years ago and was initially famous before being overshadowed

keyMoments.title: Reveals Luffy's Identity to Cavendish
keyMoments.description: Don Chinjao approaches Luffy and addresses him as 'Straw Hat', inadvertently revealing his true identity to Cavendish.
keyMoments.significance: Creates tension and conflict by exposing Luffy's disguise to someone who wants to kill the Worst Generation.
keyMoments.quote: Straw Hat Luffy! How is your grandfather Garp doing?

keyMoments.title: Explains Grudge Against Garp
keyMoments.description: Chinjao explains that thirty years ago, Garp defeated him and flattened his drill-shaped head, stripping him of his pride and ability to access his treasure.
keyMoments.significance: Connects the current generation to the past and establishes Chinjao as a legendary pirate with unfinished business.
keyMoments.quote: A long time ago, Garp nearly killed me, and I have decided to hold a grudge against his descendants!

bounties.reason: Former bounty from his prime as a legendary pirate

abilities.description: A fighting style that imbues vibrations in a strike to break the enemy's armor and weapons.

relationships.description: Chinjao bears a deep grudge against Garp for defeating him and flattening his head thirty years ago.
Chinjao wants to take revenge on Luffy as Garp's grandson, holding him responsible for his grandfather's actions.

reveals.information: Battled Garp multiple times thirty years ago and was ultimately defeated
Wants revenge on Garp's descendants for what Garp did to him
Lost his drill-shaped head and ability to access his treasure when defeated by Garp

keyMoments.title: Spring Death Knock Demonstration
keyMoments.description: Bellamy demonstrates his improved techniques from his time in the New World, using Spring Death Knock to quickly defeat multiple opponents.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Bellamy's significant growth since his defeat in Jaya and establishes him as a serious tournament contender.

bounties.reason: Increased bounty after New World adventures

abilities.description: Bellamy transforms his arm into a spring, compressing it and releasing it suddenly in a powerful long-distance punch.

reveals.information: Has become significantly stronger during his time in the New World
If he wins the tournament, he will be promoted to a high executive position in the Donquixote Family
